pros: I met great people and opportunities there.
cons: None at this current moment

review_title: HelpDesk Technician at William Paterson University
pros: Working as a helpdesk technician, you meet nice people and get to work with fun co-workers.
cons: Some cons would be that the pay is very low, management of the team can be very strict at times.

review_title: Students are down to earth and kind
pros: My colleagues and students are mostly great to work with.
cons: The pandemic hit state school budgets hard. It's been rough.

pros: Good Benefits and Fulltime Salary
cons: Great managers but low morale

pros: Easygoing and helpful professors. Comfortable environment for learning.
cons: Wild animals on campus rarely.

pros: Flexible hours Community Clear work structure
cons: "Fish bowl" work mentality Your work depends on which building you're put in

review_title: It's an ok place to work but you need to have a life plan
pros: It's a state job so you get state benefits of a pension system and great medical benefits, if you are a full time employee. Most jobs are unionized and that may or may not be a positive when it comes to job postings. However, you can transfer to another state job and keep your state status.
cons: The SES department is absolutely horrible to work in. The turnover rate is high and you are pressured to work on the weekends. If you ask about a job description from the appropriate resource, you are warned that you will be targeted. The work load is insane and you have to be bold enough to not work after hours without documentation. I had to put in writing that I will add additional worked hours to my timesheet. I had to deal with a racist colleague in the FA dept as well. His way of making up for being called out was to scream my name from across the hallway in hopes that I wouldn't report him to HR. You need to have a plan for working at WP. With so many botched layoffs, there is no guarantee of a job lasting more than 5 years at this point. My previous position was eliminated and I was mistakenly told that there was no position for me at the university (which the union corrected). Also, when I first started working at the university many years ago I had a "fake" supervisor (turns out she wasn't supposed to be supervising me and I found that out when I listed my duties on my performance assessment review) who gave me orders to drive to starbucks on Hamburg Turnpike (I just got a car and I didn't drive on anything that even looked like a highway) and I almost got into a car accident. I was a clerk typist and she was a bully. She ended up being the same person the university hired to assist as an administrative assistant for the layoffs. You have to have tough skin and find your voice. Report bullying.

pros: Good students that appreciate good teaching
cons: Uncertain future and most benefits for faculty are gone

pros: The school is pretty chill overall
cons: Honestly I'm sure more senior staff enjoy their tenure but anyone who has been in or around WP in the last few years has seen it's steady decline

review_title: Worst Job if you don't have a good supervisor

cons: No help is provided if supervisor doesn't know the technical details and research of the field you chose--however this depends on your supervisor. There's no way to get a raise in this position, so you are effectively stuck with minimum wage.

pros: Very student friendly, no pressure to do research.

job_title: Executive Administrative Assistant in Wayne, NJ

cons: No growth potential, bad morale, the University is poorly run by the executive team, Board of Trustees & the President. They continue to get their big salaries and raises while they lay off dedicated employees right before they are vested. Human Resources is an absolute joke from the top to the bottom. Save the headache, go to Montclair State or Ramapo.

review_title: Though I have a difficult supervisor, the friendships that I've developed have made up for it.
job_title: Senior Clerk Typist in Wayne, NJ
pros: State benefits are the best reasons to work for this company. With Fridays off in the summer and the ability at the end of the year to earn 4 days of comp time, these perks are pretty cool. If you are looking for a place to start your career then this is the place to be. All in all, I'm glad to have a job.
cons: Promotions are difficult. Everyone is competing for the same job that is posted. My salary is $32, 416.90 though I have 9 years of office. a bachelors and master's degree. I got my foot in the door as a clerk typist making $28k. With a union, there is a yearly increase of your salary but my cap is at $36k. So unless you get a promotion you are losing money over time.

review_title: How can a college 25 miles from NYC that's been in existence since 1855, be so unknown?
pros: Not many.  Occasionally WPUNJ can get guest speakers to come from New York City to speak on campus but these events are rare.
cons: The university misses countless opportunities to become known and to hire and/or maintain the best faculty.  The administration is hostile and dismissive toward faculty and frightened of change.  The new president is the first female president of WPUNJ but has shown that she is stuck in the old WPUNJ ways that do not work.  The WPUNJ provost is certainly one of the country's worst.  The new President is rumored to be on the verge of firing him.  This would be good but this provost has already done much damage to WPUNJ.

pros: Higher end salary. Free apt and meal plan, cheap access to gym including pool. Great students who are caring and committed. The AD is really good at their job, just tired. Supportive staff, and environment of people. You seem to be able to stay here for as long as you want. Solid starting position honestly.
cons: Facilities are falling apart. Must have vehicle to work in this position. No opportunity for upward movement. No professional development funds. The longer you stay the more likely you are to be moved, which is a hassle. Stuck in many old, paper processes, and some housing policies make no sense.

job_title: Call Center Representative in Wayne, NJ
pros: Easy work schedule, short shifts, no dress requirements, great coworkers and a lot of reward for hard work and good efforts.
cons: no opportunity for growth, very small raises, occasionally dysfunctional, and there's no reliable  clock-in system (still relying on pad and paper).

job_title: Physical Education Teacher in Lincoln Park, NJ
pros: It was a great school that supplied me with the best content knowledge that I can carry on with my field.  This university made sure that the experience was given to me for me to succeed on the next level which would be having my own class.  My career was started by William Pasterson but it is me as professional to grow and become the best teacher possible to my students.
cons: The school was fantastic and very beneficial!

pros:
-  Good amount of autonomy in designing and managing your classes.  I can choose my own textbooks, design my own syllabus, etc.
-  Department is very supportive and usually backs up their teachers when dealing with student complaint issues
-  Administration and department heads do not micro-manage their faculty.  Teachers do not have the "looking over my shoulder" feeling
cons: Quality of the students (though this is not unique to the University)

pros: Beautiful campus, walkable campus, small class sizes, quick library retrieval
cons: Budget troubles, President and chancellor have no understanding of the population of students they are teaching. They either don’t understand their student’s economic troubles or they don’t care

review_title: This is a good place for students just looking for some extra money.
pros: This is easy to fit into your schedule and work around. Meet a lot of new people and good way to network.
cons: No room for promotions and it is a stagnant pay. They are way to serious for this position and do not take into consideration the fact that the employees are students.

pros: Not micro managed- yet have full support of Chair and other full time employees- admin asst very knowledgeable & helpful as well. Great students, good diversity, good technology!
cons: Get rid of the old chalkboards!  Need better access to parking and the buildings for handicap

pros: Depending on your department, you will feel like you're a part of a team and you're valued. Most of the students are great and are excited to be at the University.
cons: I wish we could earn overtime.

cons: During final weeks, hours can be longer than usual for some positions. Might need to stay past midnight. Minimum wages for some student positions.

pros: Everyone was so helpful in my department. Any time I needed help all I had to do was walk to their office. Nice place to start your career!
